ko-fi and commissions

a good omens sideblog

summary:
brain: crowley uses the “updog” trick on aziraphale

big brain: adam gets aziraphale and crowley both on “updog”

galaxy brain:...
body:
brain: crowley uses the “updog” trick on aziraphale

big brain: adam gets aziraphale and crowley both on “updog”

galaxy brain: aziraphale hears the “updog” joke from one of the Them and uses it on crowley, who falls for it surprisingly easily. ( “angel, what are you even saying?” “oh, you know ...” a wave of his hand, “updog! crowley, dear, do you not know what updog is?” ) 

is smug about it for the next decade and tells the story to anyone who will listen.

is smug about it for the next decade and tells the story to anyone who will listen.

summary: Personally, of course, I think the purpler the prose the better, but now I'm dying over the thought of Crowley finding this...
question: Personally, of course, I think the purpler the prose the better, but now I'm dying over the thought of Crowley finding this stack of Aziraphale's old journals, and based on the style he thinks this is going to cover what he missed the last time he napped for a century, and then he gets to an entry about the two of them setting up Crowley's VCR (which was easy because they cheated), and  has that 'oh, you're just Like This' reaction.
answer:
GOD YOU’RE SO RIGHT THO

and he’s not even DISAPPOINTED, he just doesn’t know why he didn’t REALIZE

… the strangest of things, a sort of black box made of what one might only imagine was made after the chitinous shine of the older scarab beetles, although is, of course, plastic. I so detest the stuff, although I know if these devices are to take up any relevance in the decades to come, as Crowley informs me they shall - and he is seldom wrong when it comes to such little nonsenses as these - that no doubt they shall be made up again with a better exterior, which I must say, would be a relief. This hard black plastic is most dreadful to look at from any angle, even when compared with Crowley’s unspeakably sleek furnishings, and yet I recall when first the gramophones were made how ugly their materials were, and how improved came to be their appearances after a few years had passed, and the basics of the mechanism were easily transferred into casements of finer wood and gilt.

As for the purpose of the machine, I hardly know - he spoke to me at length as to its benefits, but I manfully worked to tune him out, and I must have succeeded, for I read two hundred pages of that tawdry novel when he interrupted me by declaring he was in need of a break.

From what I could gather, he had plugged the device into the wall, and accomplished naught else. No doubt he was waiting, as is so oft his way, for me to leave that he might hire some young person to set the thing up for him - he doesn’t need to, of course, but he so likes the appearance of things being properly set up.

I hardly know why: it is only me that would notice something out of place, and I wouldn’t know how to notice if this object were wrongly assembled if I tried.

summary: The Things We Want To Keep
title: The Things We Want To Keep
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2X1vcRN

by Eikaron

It’s always the little things, thinks Crowley when he sees them walk by in their light blue dress, never the big ones. Not the rise of right-wing parties all over Europe, with their familiar rhetoric and even more familiar proposals, not costumes or documentaries, nor a random medal sold on a flea-market. Those are things that remind him, things that he knows, but they don’t take him back the way a certain smell can. A voice. The colour of someone’s dress.

Words: 1504, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 3 of The Things We Remember

  • Fandoms: Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Crowley (Good Omens)
  • Additional Tags: Holocaust, Shoah, World War II, Memories, Original Character(s), Threats of Violence, Gun Violence, Nazis, Flashback, Trauma, Dark, Angst


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2X1vcRN

  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Aziraphale (Good Omens), Crowley (Good Omens)
  • Relationships: Aziraphale & Crowley (Good Omens)
  • Additional Tags: Illustrations, Fluff, Humor, Drunkenness, fun with footnotes, Book’s narration stylePre-Armageddon, Set in the year 2018, Third person but in Crowley’s POV, I put way too much research into this


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2wcRtAv

blog.name: multifandomfix
blog.title: Requests Always Open
blog.description:
The name is Edina, but you can call me Eddy if you’d like. Header made by @gypsea-0

The types of requests I do and the fandoms I do them for are linked here in my bio.

Types Of Requests

Fandoms (Characters And Ships Linked)

summary: Imagine Rowena sharing a sweet moment with toddler!Crowley after a hard day.
body:
Imagine Rowena sharing a sweet moment with toddler!Crowley after a hard day.

Rowena came in and collapsed in the nearest chair. Today had seemed six days long. “Mummy,” a young Fergus called.


“Come here, sweet pea,” she offered, holding out her arms to him. “Sit with mummy.” Fergus came over and Rowena scooped him up in her arms and sat him on her lap. Then they both drifted off to sleep.

For @angelique-of-the-volturi-guard

tags: the one thing we’re all waiting for is peace on earth and an end to war
summary: I dunno what anyone else thinks, but if Queen’s “The Miracle” doesn’t at least poke its head in at some point during the series...
body: I dunno what anyone else thinks, but if Queen’s “The Miracle” doesn’t at least poke its head in at some point during the series then I truly think someone has missed a great opportunity.
